title: 112_hr2867
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and not more than 2 terms. The Act limits members of the Commission to serving a maximum of 2 terms, with a term expiring after completing 2 full terms. Members must attend at least 75 percent of Commission meetings to be eligible for reappointment. The Act limits Commission members to 2 terms, requiring attendance of at least 75% of meetings for reappointment. No member can serve as Chair for a second consecutive term. Application of travel regulations to the Commission is specified. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to subject Commission members to travel regulations and application of antidiscrimination laws. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include antidiscrimination laws for addressing violations related to employment, labor standards, and employee protections. The Commission employees will be treated similarly to Senate or House employees for pay and employment purposes. Any pending claims can be maintained under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. SEC. 4. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2012 through 2014. SEC. 5. Amendments to standards of conduct and disclosure. SEC. 6. Termination of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to extend the termination date to September 30, 2014. A report on the effectiveness of programs promoting religious freedom must be submitted to congressional committees within one year of the Act's enactment, with consultation from relevant parties. The report required by the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 must include a review of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom, an assessment of the Office on International Religious Freedom, and a review of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom. The curr_chunk discusses the appointment of the International Religious Freedom position within the Department of State, a review of the goals of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, and a comparison of its structure with other advisory commissions. The curr_chunk discusses a review of the relationship between the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, and possible reforms to improve their goals and objectives. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in this section. The curr_chunk discusses the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
